## Who is Juan Pablo Matiz?

Juan Pablo Matiz is a Colombian economist with over 25 years of experience in logistics, transport, and strategic consulting across Latin America. He is the founder of Atiemppo (2013) and Imétrica (2012), and has led projects for the Inter-American Development Bank (IDB/BID), ECLAC/CEPAL, the World Bank, C40, ICLEI, and UN-Habitat.

## Professional Focus

- Design and evaluation of public policy in transport, logistics, and supply chains
- National logistics surveys (directed in 6 Latin American countries)
- Sustainability and decarbonization of transport
- Digital transformation applied to logistics
- Strategic consulting for governments, enterprises, and multilateral organizations
- Applied data analytics for transport and logistics

## Key Achievements

- Directed National Logistics Surveys in Colombia, Bolivia, Peru, Ecuador, Paraguay, and Costa Rica
- Published technical documents with ECLAC, IDB, World Bank, ICLEI, and Fedepalma
- Created the Proyecto Imán Mágico for Coca-Cola (award-winning innovation)
- University professor at CESA, Universidad del Rosario, and Universidad Sergio Arboleda
- 25+ years of practical and consulting experience in Latin American logistics
